page.title: 02Amenities in Eglwysbach
page.content: In Eglwysbach there are two garages. One belongs to Jacksons and the other to John Jones. There are two shops and one is called Gaynor's but it is also known as Stanley House. The other shop was called London House but it is now called the Post Office. The nearest supermarket is at Llanrwst or Llandudno. There is a village hall in Eglwysbach which is used for barn dances and discos and lots more things. The village has got a bus service and a taxi service but there is no train service. The church is called St. Martin's Church and was built more than five hundred years ago. The first vicar was called David and he came here in 1537. There is one public house in the centre of the village, The Bee, but in the olden days there used to be four.
